page.title: 01THE EXE VALLEY
page.content: The River Exe flows north to south through this block.The old water mill survives in modern form.To east and west of this area predominantly given over to agriculture, is high ground, with small fields.The flat floor of the river valley has much larger fields,resulting from the removal of hedgerows.The ancient north-south route still exists in the form of a road following the valley floor.The branch line ceased to exist in 1964. The BR main line passes from north-east to south-west through the south-east section of the block. The largest village is{REWE,}the remainder of the area having a low,scattered population.Part of the village of {THORVERTON}which has a spring which has never been known to dry up,is in the block.
